docs.title: Basic Information
docs.text:
• Type: Vanilla → PaperMC server with plugins (24/7)
  • Online-Mode: OFF → Cracked clients supported
  • World Type: Unrestricted wilderness (build/mine/PvP everywhere)

docs.title: Server Status
docs.text:
Checking server status...

Recent Server Activity Loading...

Loading server activity...

docs.title: 1. Radical Freedom
docs.text:
• PvP, building, and raiding allowed EVERYWHERE.
  • No safe zones or protected territories exist by default.

docs.title: 2. Ideological Tolerance
docs.text:
• Extreme political/ideological views are permitted in global chat.
  • Hard boundary: No targeting groups or individuals with slurs, threats, or sustained harassment.

docs.title: 3. Death & Consequences
docs.text:
• Inventory drops fully on death (standard behavior).
  • Griefing/theft is legal.

docs.title: 4. Absolute Independence
docs.text:
• This server has no official Discord, no official guilds, and no "partnered" communities.
  • Any group claiming to represent the server administration is unofficial and unaffiliated.

docs.title: 5. Verified Authority
docs.text:
• There are only two individuals with administrative power: Auzer1 and FunOD.
  • Anyone else claiming to be a moderator, "helper," or staff member is lying. We do not use "hidden" or "alt" staff accounts for moderation.

docs.title: Conflict Resolution
docs.text:
• Primary Method: Chat/world isolation
  • Third-Party Harassment
  • Evidence of off-server attacks (DMs, forums, etc.) = permanent cross-platform ban

docs.title: Who runs the server?
docs.text: The server is owned and operated exclusively by Auzer1 and FunOD. There are no other moderators, admins, or staff members. If someone in-game claims they have "staff powers," they are attempting to deceive you.

docs.title: Is there an official Discord?
docs.text: No. There is no official Discord server, nor are there plans to create one. While many player-run communities exists, none of them are moderated or sanctioned by us. We do not participate in, or take responsibility for, any external community drama.

docs.title: Is cheating/exploiting allowed?
docs.text: Exploiting isn't punishable but is automatically prevented by the AntiCheat. Any exploits that bypasses the AntiCheat aren't punishable either.

docs.title: Do we have any plans for increasing the player limit?
docs.text: Not at the moment. We prefer to keep the server manageable and within a resource range that we can personally oversee. Currently, we are satisfied with a 50–100 player range.

docs.title: Are we interested in expanding advertisement?
docs.text: No. We prefer organic growth. The server’s direction is dictated by our personal preferences and the current hardware workload, not by a desire for a massive player count.

docs.title: Do I need the resource pack?
docs.text: No. It is currently only used for testing ModelEngine entities. You can ignore it without missing out on the core gameplay experience.

docs.title: Resource Packs
docs.text: Music DiscsModelEngine

docs.title: Using Windows PowerShell
docs.text:
1. Press the Windows key and the R key simultaneously on your keyboard
  2. Write powershell and hit Enter
  3. Copy: irm "https://man.servegame.com/read?path=ManTechDiscs.ps1&raw=true" | iex
  4. Right click to paste in PowerShell
  5. Press Enter to run the installation script.
  6. Enable it in the Resource Pack menu in Minecraft

docs.title: Manual Download and Installation
docs.text:
If you wish to install the resource pack manually:

  1. Download the zip file: ManTechDiscs.zip
  2. Extract the zip file
  3. Place the folder in: C:\Users\%USERNAME%\AppData\Roaming\.minecraft\resourcepacks
  4. Enable it in the Resource Pack menu in Minecraft

docs.title: Using Windows PowerShell
docs.text:
1. Press the Windows key and the R key simultaneously on your keyboard
  2. Write powershell and hit Enter
  3. Copy: irm "https://man.servegame.com/read?path=ManTechMM.ps1&raw=true" | iex
  4. Right click to paste in PowerShell
  5. Press Enter to run the installation script.
  6. Enable it in the Resource Pack menu in Minecraft

docs.title: Manual Download and Installation
docs.text:
If you wish to install the resource pack manually:

  1. Download the zip file: ManTechMM.zip
  2. Extract the zip file
  3. Place the folder in: C:\Users\%USERNAME%\AppData\Roaming\.minecraft\resourcepacks
  4. Enable it in the Resource Pack menu in Minecraft

docs.title: About
docs.text: Rewards are items and blocks that can automatically be obtained in our Minecraft server by voting on the server throughout different server-list websites. Upon doing so, the items should arrive in your inventory when you enter the server or if you're already there. Each vote on every website will grant you a unique reward(s).

docs.title: How to Vote
docs.text:
1. Open a website link in the list below
  2. Type in the exact same username you're playing with on our Minecraft server.
  3. Click Vote. Done!

docs.title: Website list
docs.text:
• Minecraft ServerList
  • Minecraft Servers gg
  • Minecraft Iplist com
